titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James Lapine Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 04:14

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers consist of material created and accumulated by James Lapine in the course of his creative and professional activities as a playwright and director. Material includes scripts, production notes and files, correspondence, writings, printed material, audiovisual material, and photographs documenting Lapine's work on individual plays and productions, and the process of bringing a play or musical to the stage.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from George Robert Minkoff Inc. on the Adele Gutman Nathan Theatrical Collection Fund, 2006, and gift of James Lapine, 2009.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 47-50 and 63 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 53 and 61 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The James Lapine Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: James Lapine Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, and competing priorities. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, identified by a unique call number and titled according to month and year of acquisition.

The finding aid for this collection is compiled from individual preliminary lists for each acquisition that were created at or around the time of receipt by the library. The preliminary lists were migrated to comply with current archival descriptive standards and merged into a single file in 2007-2008. As part of the migration, modifications were made to the formatting of individual lists; however, the content of the lists was neither modified nor verified.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call numbers: Uncat MSS 856 and Uncat MSS 1079

bioghist.head: James Lapine (1949- )
bioghist.p: James Lapine is an American playwright and director. He was born in Mansfield, Ohio, studied at the California Institute of the Arts, and worked at the Yale University School of Drama. Lapine collaborated, as writer and director, on several musicals with Stephen Sondheim, including Sunday in the Park with George (1984), Into the Woods (1987), and Passion (1994). His other directorial credits include Falsettos (1992), for which he also wrote the libretto, The Diary of Anne Frank (1997), Golden Child (1998), Der Glockner von Notre Dame (1999), Dirty Blonde (2000), and The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee (2005). His plays include Table Setting (1978), Twelve Dreams (1978), Luck, Pluck, and Virtue (1994), The Moment When (2000), and Fran's Bed (2005).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of material created and accumulated by James Lapine in the course of his creative and professional activities as a playwright and director. Material includes scripts, production notes and files, correspondence, writings, printed material, audiovisual material, and photographs documenting Lapine's work on individual plays and productions, and the process of bringing a play or musical to the stage.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two groupings: I. May 2006 Acquisition. II. January 2009 Acquisition.

Material within this collection has been organized by acquisition reflecting the fact that the collection has been acquired in increments over time. Researchers should note that material within each acquisition overlaps with/or relates to material found in other acquisitions. For instance, scripts and production files can be found in both groupings. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers will need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section. Researchers should also note that similar material can be arranged differently in each acquisition, depending on how the material was organized when it was received by the library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized under five headings: Play Files, Assorted Scripts, Other Papers, Audiovisual Material, and Electronic Media.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This group of material contains scripts, production notes, audiocassettes, videocassettes, photographs, slides, computer disks, and other papers relating to James Lapine and his work.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Conversation between James Lapine and Stephen Sondheim. An author's video guide to producing Into the Woods .

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Audiovisual material. Restricted fragile. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A typewritten accompanying the tape reads: Dear James, Herewith Matt Bogart's tape of the Lodovicio and Giorgio scenes, plus songs. I've cued it up to the best scene only because the sound quality is horrendous on the first two scenes. Also, please keep in mind that he didn't have much time with material because of his performance and rehearsal schedule. He feels he can do much better in person. Please let me know your thoughts. Sincerely, Victorria Johnson.

scopecontent.p: This tape begins with an intro to Sunday in the Park with George , but it then it cuts to a program on architect Philip Johnson, then various other programming including a "60 Minutes" segment and a baseball game.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Audiovisual material. Restricted fragile. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A note is included with this audiocassette. It reads: This recording was made through the sound system for the purposes of planning the cast album. The recording was made during previews and it was, we believe, the final performance of Bill Duff Griffin as the doctor. In any case, it was around this time. It remains a record of the show during the preview period.

It remains a record of the show during the preview period.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged under two headings: Play Files, and Electronic Media.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This portion of the collection includes correspondence, writings, notes, printed material, production files, research files, scripts, and other papers. Files have been left in the order in which they were received by the library
Former call number: Uncat MSS 1079

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 61 (computer disks): Restricted Fragile Material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
